intro: Uragoga vogeliana, commonly known as the Vogel's uragoga, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
